column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////One note; I think there is a wall you hit with steak. Once you have the best meat
column4: it can only get just so good. So
column5: it's hard for me to say the steak I devoured last night was "better" than the 40 day-er at David Burke's Primehouse
column6: the exquisitely marveled porterhouse or ribeye at Gibson's or any of the masterpieces of meat at the handful of places that do it exactly right. After that
column7: it comes down to personal preference and taste and where you feel most comfortable.
